episode_title: 508 - The One With The Thanksgiving Flashbacks

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, everyone has just finished Thanksgiving dinner and are groaning over their fullness.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh Monica that was the best Thanksgiving dinner ever! I think you killed us.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I couldn’t possibly eat another bite.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I need something sweet.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Does anyone wanna watch TV?

content.speaker: All
content.text: Yeah, sure.
(She starts pushing the power button on the remote, but it’s not facing the TV so it doesn’t work.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Monica your remote doesn’t work.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phoebe, you have to lift it and point.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh. Aw, forget it.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, you know what we should all do? We should play that game where everyone says one thing that they’re thankful for.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ooh-ooh, I! I am thankful for this beautiful fall we’ve been having.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s very nice.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s sweet, Joey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, the other day I was at the bus-stop and this lovely fall breeze came in out of nowhere and blew this chick’s skirt right up. Oh! Which reminds me, I’m also thankful for thongs. (Note: Actually, I think every guy is thankful for thongs. That and spandex. :-) )

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, continued from earlier. Joey is talking about the wonder that is the thong.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I mean, it’s not so much an underpant as it is a feat of engineering. I mean, it’s amazing how much they can do with so little material! And the way they play with your mind! Is it there? Is it not there?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Are you aware that you’re still talking?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Is anyone thankful for anything else besides a thong?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Huh, I don’t know what to pick. Am I more thankful for my divorce or my eviction? Hmm.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wow! See, and I didn’t think you’d be able to come up with anything.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m sorry. It’s just that this is the worse Thanksgiving ever.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No-no-no! I am the king of bad Thanksgivings. You can’t just swoop in here with your bad marriage and take that away from me.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, you’re not gonna tell the whole story about how your parents got divorced again are you?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh God, no.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, come on! I wanna hear it! It wouldn’t be Thanksgiving without Chandler bumming us out!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It’s a tradition, like the parade. If the parade decided it was gay, moved out, and abandoned its entire family.
(And with that, we start a series of flashbacks to Thanksgiving’s of years gone by.)

content.description: The Bing household, Mr. and Mrs. Bing and Young Chandler are eating Thanksgiving dinner as a housekeeper serves them.

content.speaker: Mrs. Bing
content.text: Now Chandler dear, just because your father and I are getting a divorce it doesn’t mean we don’t love you. It just means he would rather sleep with the house-boy than me.

content.speaker: The Housekeeper
content.text: More turkey Mr. Chandler? (And he makes eyes at him.)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, continued from earlier.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You’re right. Yours is worse. You are the king of bad Thanksgivings.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I don’t know about that. I’ve got one that’s worse.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Really? Worse than, “More turkey Mr. Chandler?”

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, did the little rich boy have a problem with the butler? Yes, mine’s worse!

content.description: A Union battlefield hospital, Phoebe, in a past life, is tending to a wounded Union soldier. (By the way, for historical perspective, 1862 was the second year of the American Civil War.)

content.speaker: Past Life Phoebe
content.text: More bandages! More bandages! Please, can I get some more bandages in here! This man is dying—(She is cut off by an exploding shell just outside the tent. When the smoke clears, she’s missing an arm and the blood is pumping out like you’d see in a horror movie. And upon seeing her condition, she says…) Oh no.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, continued from earlier.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: In this life, Phoebe.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, this life! Oh okay no, Chandler’s is worse.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Man, it must be so cool remembering stuff like that! I don’t have any past life memories.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Of course you don’t sweetie. You’re brand new.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I know Monica’s worst Thanksgiving.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, let’s not tell this story.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Oh, come on!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh no, I know! I know! It’s the one where Joey got Monica’s turkey stuck on his head!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?! Joey got a turkey stuck on his head?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, it’s not like it sounds.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It’s exactly like it sounds.

content.description: Monica and Phoebe’s, Phoebe is entering.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hello?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hello?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Phoebe?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Joey? What’s going on?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Look. (He walks out of the bathroom with his head stuck in a huge turkey.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I know! It’s stuck!!!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Easy. Step. How did it get on?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I put it on to scare Chandler!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God! Monica’s gonna totally freak out!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well then help me get it off! Plus, it smells really bad in here.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, of course it smells really bad. You have your head up a dead animal.
(They hear Monica trying to unlock the door. So Phoebe quickly pushes his head down onto the table to make it look like the turkey is just sitting on a platter and not stuck on Joey’s head.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey, did you get the turkey basted—Oh my God! Oh my God! (She sees someone is stuck in the turkey.) Who is that?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: It’s Joey.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What-what are you doing? Is this supposed to be funny?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, it’s not supposed to be funny, it’s supposed to be scary.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, get it off now!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I can’t! It-it’s stuck!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, I don’t care! That-that turkey has to feed 20 people at my parent’s house and they’re not gonna eat it off your head!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: All right, hold on! Okay, let’s just all think.

(They all start thinking. Joey starts rubbing his chin, of course his chin is currently inside the turkey so he ends up rubbing the turkey. And I didn’t do that joke one bit of justice. It’s one of those you have to see it to get it jokes.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, I got it. Phoebe? All right, you pull. I’m gonna spread the legs as wide as I can. (Joey starts giggling.) Joey? Now is not the time!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Sorry! Sorry.
(They get into position to pull the turkey off.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, count to three. 1. 2. 3!
(They both pull but Joey slips out and starts to fall backwards just as Chandler enters, scaring him.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Arghhhhhh!! (Joey turns around to taunt him, but Chandler is in the doorway and Joey is facing the kitchen.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: It worked! I scared ya, I knew it! Ha-ha!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m over here big guy.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, you are! (Starts dancing.) I scared you!
content.parenthetical: turning all the way around, and still not facing Chandler

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, continued from earlier.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You did look like an idiot.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, I wasn’t the only one who looked like an idiot. All right? Remember when Ross tried to say, “Butternut squash?” And it came out, “Squatternut buash?”

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah that’s the same.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s it. That’s my worse Thanksgiving.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh wait! That can’t be the one Rachel’s talking about. She didn’t even know that happened. So which one was it?

content.speaker: All
content.text: Which one?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Umm, I-I really don’t want to tell this story.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, come on Monica, reliving past pain and getting depressed is what Thanksgiving is all about. Y’know, for me anyway. And of course, the Indians.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Look umm, of all people, you do not want me to tell this story!

content.description: The Geller household, Mr. and Mrs. Geller are getting ready for Thanksgiving dinner. The doorbell rings.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Monica! I think Rachel’s here!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’ll get it! (She runs in, and she’s her old fat self like The One With The Prom Video. Not only that, she’s out of breath after running a short distance. She goes over and opens the door to reveal Rachel with her old nose.) Happy Thanksgiving!

content.speaker: Big Nosed Rachel
content.text: Not for me. Chip and I broke up!

content.speaker: Fat Monica
content.text: Oh, why? Why? What happened?

content.speaker: Big Nosed Rachel
content.text: Well, you know that my parents are out of town and Chip was going to come over…

content.speaker: Fat Monica
content.text: Yeah, yeah, and you were going him y’know, your flower.

content.speaker: Big Nosed Rachel
content.text: Okay, Monica, can you just call it sex?! It really creeps me out when you call it that! Okay, and by the way, while we’re at it, a guy’s thing is not called his tenderness. Believe me! (Walks into the living room and greets Monica’s parents.) Hi!

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Hi Rachel!

content.speaker: Big Nosed Rachel
content.text: Happy Thanksgiving!

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: You too sweethart!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!
(He brought home Chandler for Thanksgiving. Chandler is sporting the very popular Flock of Seagulls haircut. Yeah, it’s another you have to see it to believe it kinda thing.)

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Oh my!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh, everyone, this is Chandler! My roommate and lead singer of our band!

content.speaker: Fat Monica
content.text: Ross! (Wanting to be introduced.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, this is Monica.

content.speaker: Fat Monica
content.text: Hi, I’m Ross’s little sister.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: I’m so glad you could come Chandler, we’ve got plenty of food so I hope you’re hungry.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, mom. Mom. Chandler hates Thanksgiving and doesn’t eat any Thanksgiving food.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Oh, well, I’m so glad you brought him here then.

content.speaker: Fat Monica
content.text: Umm, Chandler, if you want I can make you some macaroni and cheese for dinner.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, as long as the pilgrims didn’t eat it, I’m in.
(As she is drinking, Monica laughs and Chandler’s joke and Diet Coke comes out of her nose.)

content.speaker: Fat Monica
content.text: dammit! (Runs off.)
(Ross points out Rachel to Chandler and goes over to talk to her. Rachel is checking out her nose in her compact mirror.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So uh, Rach? Does it, does it feel weird around here now? Y’know since I’ve been away at college.

content.speaker: Big Nosed Rachel
content.text: Oh! No, not really.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, that’s cool. So did… (She walks away from him and he shuts up.)
(Rachel wanders into the kitchen where Monica is making Chandler’s dinner.)

content.speaker: Big Nosed Rachel
content.text: Ugh! I cannot believe Chip dumped me for that slut Nancy Branson. I am never going out with him again. I don’t care how much he begs!

content.speaker: Fat Monica
content.text: I think his begging days are over now that he’s going out with Nancy Branson.

content.speaker: Big Nosed Rachel
content.text: Y’know what? I’ve just had it with high school boys! They are just silly. (Ross is overhearing this.) Silly, stupid boys! I’m going to start dating men!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Umm, I’m sorry Judy, I couldn’t find that bowl that you and Jack were looking for.

content.speaker: Fat Monica
content.text: Call them mom and dad you loser!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Monica!
[Time lapse, dinner has finished and Chandler is sitting on the couch eating some pie. Monica sits down beside him, and he gets pushed up a little by the wave she makes in the couch.]

content.speaker: Fat Monica
content.text: Hey Chandler! Did you like the macaroni and cheese?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh yeah, it was great. You should be a chef.

content.speaker: Fat Monica
content.text: Okay!
(He gets up and walks away as Rachel come running over all excited.)

content.speaker: Big Nosed Rachel
content.text: Guess what?! All that stuff about Nancy Branson being a slut was all a rumor so Chip dumped her and he wants to come over to my house tonight!

content.speaker: Fat Monica
content.text: Oh that’s so great!

content.speaker: Big Nosed Rachel
content.text: I know!

content.speaker: Fat Monica
content.text: Oh gosh, listen if you and Chip do it tonight, promise me you’ll tell me everything.

content.speaker: Big Nosed Rachel
content.text: Oh totally, totally. Y’know it’s not that big of deal, we already kinda did it once y’know.

content.speaker: Fat Monica
content.text: I know, but y’know, this time you’re gonna definitely know whether or not you did it!

content.speaker: Big Nosed Rachel
content.text: I know, I know. And oh, and this time Chip promised that-that this time it will last at least for an entire song!
[Cut to the kitchen, Ross and Chandler are doing the dishes.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So I’m thinking about asking Rachel out tonight. Y’know maybe play her that song we wrote last week.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Emotional Knapsack?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Right on! Oh! Uh, but, don’t take to long okay? ’Cause uh, we’re gonna test out our fake ID’s tonight, right Clifford Alverez.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Listen, Roland Chang, if things go well, I’m gonna be out with her all night.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Dude, don’t do that too me!
(Monica enters behind them.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right, it’s cool you can stay here. My parents won’t mind.
(Monica suddenly gets very happy.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, it’s not that, I just don’t want to be stuck here all night with your fat sister.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!
(Upon hearing this, Monica starts to break down and storms out. Only to be stopped by her parents.)

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Monica, why don’t you finish off these pies? I don’t have any more room left in the fridge.

content.speaker: Fat Monica
content.text: No. No, thank you!

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Well Judy, you did it! She’s finally full!

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, back to the present day.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I called you fat?! I don’t even remember that!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, I do.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I am so sorry. I really am. I was an idiot back then. I rushed the stage at a Wham concert for crying out loud!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, I can’t believe you called her fat.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I can’t believe you let George Michael slap you.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I am really sorry. That is so terrible. I am so, so sorry.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Actually, y’know that’s not the Thanksgiving I was talking about.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes, it was!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, it wasn’t. It was actually the…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, now Thanksgiving’s over, let’s get ready for Christmas. Who wants to go get a Christmas tree?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, no, I have the cutest Christmas story!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: We wanna hear Monica’s Thanksgiving story!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Fine, all right, mine had a dwarf that got broke in half, but y’know whatever.

content.description: The Geller household kitchen, Mrs. Geller is cooking and Rachel, post nose job, is helping her.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: So Rachel, your mom tells me you changed your major again.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, yeah, I had too. There was never any parking by the Psychology building.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Hi Rachel.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh hi!

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Wow, love your new nose!

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Jack.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: What? Dr. Wilson’s an artist! He removed my mole cluster. Wanna see? (He starts to show her as the doorbell rings.)

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: I’ll get it.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, God! Please, let me! (Runs out.)

(She opens the door to reveal Chandler and Ross. Unfortunately, they seem to have their holidays mixed up. They think it’s Halloween and they’re going as Crockett and Tubbs from that legendary TV show of the late 80’s, Miami Vice. God, we looked silly back then!)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey. (To his parents) Happy Thanksgiving!

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: God, your hair sure is different!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, we were just talking about that. I can’t believe how stupid we used to look. (They both quickly push their sleeves over their elbows.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So uh, where’s Monica?

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: She’s upstairs. Monica! Come down! Everyone’s here! Ross, Rachel, and the boy who hates Thanksgiving.
(Monica enters, but she forgot something. Oh, about 150 pounds. In other words, she lost weight, big time!)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi, Chandler.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh my God!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What-what’s the matter? Is there, is there something on my dress? (She turns around making sure he gets a good look.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You just, you look so different! Terrific! That dress! That body!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Dude!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Sorry!

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Yes, yes Monica is thin. It’s wonderful. But what we really want to hear about is Ross’s new girlfriend.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh mom! Okay, umm, her name is Carol. And she’s really pretty. And smart. And uh, she’s-she’s on the lacrosse team and the golf team. Can you believe it? She plays for both teams!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So Chandler, I guess I’ll see you at dinner.
(She heads for the kitchen and Chandler watches her leave and admires the view.)

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Dude!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Sorry.
(In the kitchen.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh-ho, my God! That was so awesome! You totally got him back for calling you fat! He was just drooling all over you. That must’ve felt so great!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well it didn’t!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, I mean yeah, I look great. Yeah, I feel great and yeah, my heart is not in trouble anymore! Blah, blah, blah! Y’know I still don’t feel like I got him back, y’know? I just want to humiliate him. I wanna, I want him to be like naked and then I’m going to point at him and laugh!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, that we may be able to do.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: How?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well guys tend to get naked before they’re gonna have sex.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?! I mean, I didn’t work this hard and-and-and lose all this weight so that I can give my flower to someone like him!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, first of all, if you keep calling it that, no one’s gonna ever take it. Then, second of all you’re not actually gonna have sex with him! You’re just gonna make him think that you are.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: And when he’s naked I can throw him out in the front yard and lock the door and all the neighbors will just humiliate him!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Then, you will definitely get him back!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, so how do I make him think I wanna have sex with him?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, oh, here’s what you do. Just act like everything around you turns you on.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What do you mean?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, like anything can be sexy. Like umm, oh-oh, like this dishtowel! (She grabs it and starts rubbing it on her cheek.) Ooh, ooh, this feels sooo good against my cheek! And-and if I feel a little hot, I can just dab myself with it. Or I can bring it down to my side and bring it through my fingers while I talk to him.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I can do that!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah? Okay! Good, good, because he’s coming. He’s coming. (To Chandler) Hey, what’s up? (She leaves and closes the door behind her.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Monica, I was wondering if you can make me some of that righteous mac and cheese like last year.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Umm, I’d love too! (She goes over and picks up the box and decides to follow Rachel’s advice and holds the box up to her cheek.) Ooh, I love macaroni and cheese. I love-I love the way this box feels against my cheek.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Boy, I love carrots! Oh! (She picks up a bunch of them and holds them between her fingers.) Sometimes I like to put them between my fingers like this and-and hold them down here while I talk to you. (She is rubbing her hip with the carrots.) Umm, and-and-and y’know if I get really hot umm, I-I like to pick up this knife (She picks up a knife without putting the box down. She’s holding the box between her cheek and shoulder) and-and umm, I-I put the cold steal against umm, (Pause) my body. (She doesn’t have any exposed skin within reach of the knife, so while holding the carrots in one hand and the box between her face and shoulder, she rubs the knife on her stomach.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Are you all right?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh yeah, of course. I’m fine it’s just that—(She drops the box and in a reflex action tries to catch it with her arm, the knife slips out and slowly flips through the air and comes point first down into Chandler’s shoe.)

content.description: The hospital, Chandler has been rushed to the emergency room.

content.speaker: The Doctor
content.text: What do we got here?

content.speaker: The Paramedic
content.text: Twenty year old has got a severed toe on his right foot.
(They go through the doors into the trauma room, opening them by ramming the gurney through them, only Chandler’s foot is hanging off the end and he screams in pain.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Can you please not do that feet first? You know where his injury is! Severed toe, you just said it!

content.speaker: The Doctor
content.text: It says here that the knife went right through your shoe.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Of course it did. They’re made of wicker.

content.speaker: The Doctor
content.text: Did you bring the toe?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh yes! I have it right here, on ice! (She takes a bag of ice out of her purse and hands it to the doctor.)

content.speaker: The Doctor
content.text: Don’t worry son, we’ll just attach it and—(Stops suddenly.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?! What is it?

content.speaker: The Doctor
content.text: You brought a carrot.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?

content.speaker: The Doctor
content.text: This isn’t your toe, this is a small, very cold piece of carrot.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You brought a carrot?!

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Oh my God! There’s a toe in my kitchen.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: God, I’m sorry! I’ll go back and get it!

content.speaker: The Doctor
content.text: It’s too late, all we can do now is sow up the wound.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Without my toe?! I need my toe!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wait, no-no-no, I can go really fast! Dad, give me the keys to your Porsche !

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Oh, I’m not falling for that one!

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Chandler is reacting to the story.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s why I lost my toe?! Because I called you fat?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I didn’t mean to cut it off. It was an accident.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s why for an entire year people called me Sir Limps-A-Lot?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m sorry! It wasn’t your whole toe!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, well, I miss the tip! It’s the best part. It has the nail. (He storms out.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Chandler! (Follows him out.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Sir Limps-A-Lot, I came up with that.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You’re a dork.
[Cut to the hallway, Chandler is standing in front of his door.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I can’t believe this.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Chandler, I said I was sorry.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, well, sorry doesn’t bring back the little piggy that cried all the way home! I hate this stupid day! And everything about it! I’ll see you later.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh wait, Chandler, come here is there anything I can do? Anything?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, just leave me alone for a while. (He goes into his apartment.)

content.description: Chandler, Joey, and Ross’s, Chandler is sitting on one of the chairs and the duck is running around him and quacking.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh-oh, I’m a duck! I go, “Quack, quack!” I’m happy all the time!
(There’s a knock on the door and Chandler gets up to answer it. He opens the door to reveal Monica with a turkey over her head.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Nice try.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wait, wait, wait! (She puts a Shriner’s hat on the turkey.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Look, Monica…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Look! (She puts a big, yellow pair of sunglasses on the bird.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: This is not going to work.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I bet this will work! (She starts dancing and Chandler cracks up.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You are so great! I love you!
(Monica stops suddenly and turns around slowly.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Nothing! I said, I said “You’re so great” and then I just, I just stopped talking!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You said you loved me! I can’t believe this!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No I didn’t!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes, you did!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No I didn’t!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You love me!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No I don’t! Stop it! Stop it! Stop it! Stop it!
(Joey walks in and sees Monica. He freaks out and runs back into the hallway, screaming.)

content.description: The Western front during World War I, Phoebe, in yet another past life, is once again a nurse tending to yet another dying soldier. But this time she’s doing it with a French accent.

content.speaker: French Phoebe
content.text: Gauze! Gauze! I need to get some gauze in here! Can I please get some gauze in here! (A shell explodes outside next to the tent and when the smoke clears, Phoebe still has her arm.) Whew! (Her arm falls off and starts pumping out blood.) This is getting ridiculous uh!
